sections.name: Takatorra (Daitengu Form)
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Tengu
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the tengu ancestry. Tengu are humanoids who resemble crows. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by tengu. An item with this trait is created and used by tengu.

link.name: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48
link.alt: Pathfinder #168: King of the Mountain pg. 48

gear.name: +3 major striking fell tengu gale blades

universal_monster_ability.name: Attack of Opportunity
universal_monster_ability.trigger: A creature within the monster's reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action it's using.
universal_monster_ability.effect: The monster attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the monster disrupts that action. This Strike doesn't count toward the monster's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

automatic_abilities.name: Toughest Teamwork: Wind Shell
automatic_abilities.trigger: An ally within 60 feet is targeted by a physical ranged attack
automatic_abilities.effect: Takatorra wraps their ally in a protective shell of air. The ally gains a +4 status bonus to AC against physical ranged attacks until the beginning of their next turn.

traits.name: Abjuration
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the abjuration school of magic, typically involving protection or wards.

traits.name: Air
traits.text:
Effects with the air trait either manipulate or conjure air. Those that manipulate air have no effect in a vacuum or an area without air. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of air or have a connection to magical air.   
  
Planes with this trait consist mostly of open spaces and air of various levels of turbulence, though they also contain rare islands of floating stone and other elements and energies. Air planes usually have breathable atmospheres, though they might include clouds of acidic or toxic gas. Earth creatures often find themselves at a disadvantage within air planes, as there’s little solid ground for them to gain their bearings, which tends to at least make them uncomfortable.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Disarm
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Disarm with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls (if any) as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Disarm using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure. On a critical success, you still need a free hand if you want to take the item.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Air
traits.text:
Effects with the air trait either manipulate or conjure air. Those that manipulate air have no effect in a vacuum or an area without air. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of air or have a connection to magical air.   
  
Planes with this trait consist mostly of open spaces and air of various levels of turbulence, though they also contain rare islands of floating stone and other elements and energies. Air planes usually have breathable atmospheres, though they might include clouds of acidic or toxic gas. Earth creatures often find themselves at a disadvantage within air planes, as there’s little solid ground for them to gain their bearings, which tends to at least make them uncomfortable.

traits.name: Range
traits.text: These attacks will either list a finite range or a range increment, which follows the normal rules for range increments.

ability.name: Airflow Blades

traits.name: Air
traits.text:
Effects with the air trait either manipulate or conjure air. Those that manipulate air have no effect in a vacuum or an area without air. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of air or have a connection to magical air.   
  
Planes with this trait consist mostly of open spaces and air of various levels of turbulence, though they also contain rare islands of floating stone and other elements and energies. Air planes usually have breathable atmospheres, though they might include clouds of acidic or toxic gas. Earth creatures often find themselves at a disadvantage within air planes, as there’s little solid ground for them to gain their bearings, which tends to at least make them uncomfortable.

ability.text: Takatorra extends the cutting surface of their blades with high-pressure airflow. Until the end of their turn, their blades have a reach of 15 feet.

ability.name: Blade Barrage
ability.text: Takatorra unleashes a flurry of attacks. Takatorra makes five melee Strikes. They gain a cumulative +2 circumstance bonus to damage for each successful Strike. If one target is hit with at least two of these Strikes, they also take 2d6 persistent bleed damage. They then become stunned 1 and flat-footed until the start of their next turn.

ability.name: Disarming Whirl

traits.name: Flourish
traits.text: Actions with the flourish trait are special techniques that require too much exertion for you to perform frequently. You can use only one action with the flourish trait per round.

ability.text: Takatorra spins, striking at their foes' weapons. Takatorra attempts an Athletics check to Disarm against each enemy within their melee reach. Each attempt counts toward Takatorra's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until they have made all the attempts.
